Description: Sandal with lower sole of flat-section palm woven in a coarse weave. Upper sole of finer weave and the upper woven in the same technique but in much finer weave in one piece, low sides and back, small cover for the toes. Sewn together with bunches of round section fibre. A broken, but elegantly plaited tie towards the rear designed to pass in front of the ankle. Probably another tie between the toes.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Qasr Ibrim (Nubia), Cathedral (east of) surface
Acquisition name: Division of Finds: Egyptian Antiquities Organisation
